column1: "On this basis I think that the notion of having something in one's possession

i
nvolves a mental element. It involves in the first place that you know that you have
something in your possession. It does not, however, involve that you know precisely what

i
t
 
i
s
 
that you have got." And, at p.403 and p.289, the learned Law Lord said: "The question
resolves itself into one as to the nature and extent of the mental element which is involved
